A perfect 5-day itinerary to explore the magic of Sikkim
Vinita Jain
What's the story
Sikkim, a small Indian state in the Himalayas, is famous for its stunning landscapes and rich culture.
For those looking to explore this beautiful state, this five-day itinerary will take you on a journey through some of its most famous places.
From lush valleys to snow-capped peaks, Sikkim has it all.
Here's how you can make the most of your trip with this detailed guide.
Day 1
Exploring Gangtok's attractions
Start your Sikkim adventure in Gangtok, the state's capital. Visit the Enchey Monastery and enjoy panoramic views from Tashi View Point. Stroll through MG Road for shopping and local cuisine. Don't miss the Namgyal Institute of Tibetology for insights into Tibetan culture and history. Spend your evening relaxing at one of Gangtok's cafes or enjoying a quiet walk along its well-maintained paths.
Day 2
Discovering Pelling's beauty
Travel to Pelling on day two to witness some of Sikkim's most breathtaking views. The town is famous for its views of the Kanchenjunga range. Visit Pemayangtse Monastery, one of the oldest monasteries in Sikkim, and explore Rabdentse Ruins for a glimpse into history. The Khecheopalri Lake is a serene spot ideal for reflection and nature walks.
Day 3
Experiencing Yuksom's heritage
On day three, head to Yuksom, the first capital of Sikkim. This place is rich in history and surrounded by lush greenery. Trekking enthusiasts can explore trails leading to Dzongri or Goecha La for stunning views of Mount Kanchenjunga. Visit Dubdi Monastery, which offers a peaceful retreat amidst nature's beauty.
Day 4
Immersing in Lachung's landscapes
Travel northwards on day four towards Lachung via Yumthang Valley, known as "The Valley of Flowers." The valley blooms with colorful flowers during springtime, making it an ideal spot for photography lovers. In winter, it transforms into a snowy wonderland, perfect for snow activities like skiing or snowboarding, if conditions permit.
Day 5
Enjoying Lachen's tranquility
End your journey by visiting Lachen, another picturesque village in North Sikkim, famous for its tranquility and scenic beauty. Take short treks around Lachen, which lead to beautiful spots like Shingba Rhododendron Sanctuary, especially vibrant in March-April when rhododendrons bloom across the region.
